meanings.definition: A fictional or hypothetical person whose physical abilities are extended beyond normal human limitations by mechanical elements built into the body.
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the cyborgs had robotic limbs that gave them super strength.
meanings.sent2: The novel featured cyborgs with advanced technology integrated into their bodies.
meanings.sent3: The cyborgs at the science fiction convention had glowing eyes and metal parts.
meanings.sent4: The cyborgs in the story were like humans merged with machines, a blend of biology and technology.
meanings.sent5: The cyborgs in the video game were half-human, half-robot, creating a unique character design.

meanings.definition: A person whose physiological functioning is aided by or dependent upon a mechanical or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: The injured soldier became a cyborgs after receiving a bionic arm.
meanings.sent2: Some individuals with heart conditions rely on cyborgs to regulate their heartbeat.
meanings.sent3: The cyborgs in the hospital had artificial organs that beeped and whirred.
meanings.sent4: The cyborgs in the futuristic world had implants that enhanced their senses.
meanings.sent5: The cyborgs in the lab were test subjects for the latest prosthetic technology.
